summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from July 3, 2020, regarding a potential witness who contacted the FBI via LinkedIn. The witness, a woman, claims to have information related to a rape she experienced 20 years prior that may be connected to the Epstein investigation. The emails coordinate the FBI's response and interview logistics.

persons.name: Maguire
persons.context: Special Agent-in-Charge Maguire is copied on the email; her team is handling the Epstein investigation and will have agents reach out to the witness.

persons.name: ADIC
persons.context: The Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) of the FBI New York Field Office is mentioned as the initial point of contact for the witness, who reached out via LinkedIn.

connections.description: Both are senior FBI officials in the New York Field Office involved in coordinating the response to a potential witness in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Witness contacts FBI via LinkedIn
events.description: A woman contacts the FBI's Assistant Director in Charge via LinkedIn, claiming to have information about a rape from 20 years ago that may connect to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Alleged rape of witness
events.description: The witness states she was raped 20 years prior to the email (circa 2000) and had previously tried to seek justice but the climate was not conducive.

keyFacts: A potential witness proactively contacted the FBI's New York Field Office via LinkedIn on July 3, 2020, offering information related to a rape from approximately 20 years earlier that she believes may connect to the Epstein investigation.
The witness expressed a preference for a Zoom interview over a phone call for security reasons, citing a recent bad online experience and living under provable online threat for over 20 years.

The FBI internal correspondence shows coordination between the Assistant Director in Charge and Special Agent-in-Charge Maguire's team, which was handling the Epstein investigation, to arrange contact with the witness.
The witness mentioned she was waiting for Scotland Yard to find notes from over 20 years ago to help her seek justice and recompense.
